		Question: who was sir walter raleigh and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: Sir Walter Raleigh was an English explorer, courtier, and writer. He was born in Devon, England, in 1552. He served as a soldier in the Netherlands and Ireland, and later became a favorite of Queen Elizabeth I. Raleigh was granted a charter to colonize North America, and in 1585 he established the first English colony in the New World on Roanoke Island. He also explored the Amazon River and the Orinoco River. Raleigh was executed for treason in 1618.
